issue.title: Build a Greeting CLI
issue.body:
## Build a Simple Greeting CLI

Create a CLI that greets users by name.

### Commands
```bash
greet hello John    # Output: Hello, John!
greet goodbye John  # Output: Goodbye, John!
```

### Files
- `src/index.ts` - CLI entry with commander
- `src/greet.ts` - Greeting functions

### Requirements
- TypeScript
- Use commander.js
- Keep it minimal

ems.task: Initialize the project with .gitignore, package.json with commander.js dependency, tsconfig.json, and src directory structure

analysisSummary: Implement a simple greeting CLI with TypeScript and commander.js. The project will be initialized with standard Node.js/TypeScript configuration, then implement the core CLI structure with hello and goodbye commands.

pendingEMs.task: Implement core greeting logic functions (hello, goodbye) in src/greet.ts
Build CLI entry point with commander.js in src/index.ts, configure hello and goodbye subcommands, wire up to greeting functions
